suggestedNewContent.title: Buttons Are Like Light Switches
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Compare buttons to physical light switches - they have an action (onPressed), a visual appearance (style), and can be disabled (like a broken switch). Just as different switches control different things, different button types serve different UI purposes.

suggestedNewContent.title: Choosing the Right Button Type
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Decision guide: ElevatedButton for primary/prominent actions, FilledButton for primary without elevation, TextButton for secondary/less important actions, OutlinedButton for medium emphasis, IconButton for toolbars and compact areas, FAB for the main screen action. Include visual hierarchy diagram.

suggestedNewContent.title: Complete Button Types Showcase
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show working code examples for ALL button types side by side: ElevatedButton, FilledButton, FilledButton.tonal, TextButton, OutlinedButton, IconButton with proper styling for each.

suggestedNewContent.title: Buttons with Icons
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show ElevatedButton.icon, TextButton.icon, OutlinedButton.icon, FilledButton.icon constructors for creating buttons that combine icons with text.

suggestedNewContent.title: Common Button Mistakes
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover: 1) Forgetting to pass onPressed (button becomes disabled), 2) Putting InkWell without Material parent (no ripple), 3) Not providing accessible labels, 4) Making buttons too small for touch targets, 5) Overusing FAB (should only be one per screen).

suggestedNewContent.title: Theme-Based Button Styling
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show how to define button styles at the theme level using ElevatedButtonThemeData, TextButtonThemeData etc. for consistent app-wide button appearance.

summary: The lesson has a solid foundation with correct code examples and good structure, but suffers from incomplete content sections (Colors, Size sections are just headers), missing critical Material 3 button types (FilledButton, FilledButton.tonal), and lacks pedagogical elements like analogies and warning sections. The button types section only shows code for FAB while listing others without examples. The challenge hints and common mistakes are generic rather than button-specific. Priority is HIGH because incomplete sections and missing button types would confuse beginners and leave them with outdated knowledge.
